resources.string: Correct the sentences using the simple present form

string.name: correctSentencesQ1
string.b: 1) My mother is taking me to school every day.

string.name: correctSentencesQ2
string.b: 2) I eat to breakfast in the morning.

string.name: correctSentencesQ3
string.b: 3) My uncle is lives in Vijayawada.

string.name: correctSentencesQ4
string.b: 4) I am coming to school by bus.

string.name: correctSentencesQ5
string.b: 5) I gone to my grandparent’s village during the vacations.

string.name: correctSentencesQ6
string.b: 6) I am watching Chota Bheem at 6 o’clock every evening.

string.name: correctSentencesQ7
string.b: 7) Majeed will did his homework before I go to play.

string.name: correctSentencesQ8
string.b: 8) My father reading the newspaper every day.

string.name: correctSentencesQ9
string.b: 9) My friend is having two dogs.

string.name: correctSentencesQ10
string.b: 10) Brinda is always coming first in the examinations.

resources.string: How do you celebrate your birthday?

string.name: TellHowToCelebrate
string.b: Tell us how you celebrate your birthday.

resources.string: I take the bus to school every day.
I wake up at 7:30 in the morning.
I like to eat dosa and chutney.
My mother helps me with my homework in the evening.
I cut a cake on my birthday.
I will eat lunch at school every day.
My grandfather drunk coffee every morning.
Ex :Hello,I am Sara. My Birthday is on 2nd September
When you meet someone or before a conversation, it is important to begin with a greeting. Greetings can be of two kinds:
You greet people older than you formally. These include, parents, uncles, aunts, teachers, parents of friends.
The formal way of greeting is more polite and well mannered.
Phrases used for formal greetings are:
Good morning (for the morning, up to 12 o’clock)
Good afternoon (from the afternoon, up to 5’o clock)
Good evening (for the rest of the evening)
If you are meeting someone for the first time, it is important to introduce yourself after the greeting.
To introduce yourself, you can use phrases like:
Proper Nouns are the names of people, places and organisations and things.
\u25BA She is Sonia. She comes from Visakhapatnam with her parents.
\u25BA Her mother works at the State Bank of India.
All proper nouns begin with a capital letter.
If the proper noun has more than one word, each of the words begin with a capital letter.
\u25BA Sonia visited the Taj Mahal at Agra with her parents last year.
\u25BA Sonia is a Christian and celebrates Christmas on 25th December.
\u25BA Sonia likes to sing. Her favourite singer is P.Susheela.
\u25BA She wants to study hard and join the Indian Administrative Services
A New Student has joined your class. How would you introduce yourself? Complete the conversation given below:
May I know your good name?
My name is Madhu.How are You?
My good name is Madhu.How you doing?
Which place you are coming from?
Come, let me introduce you to the others.
Good Morning! What is your name?
Hello! Good morning! My name is SwarnaLatha,I am Indian.
Good evening! No,I am not busy.What is your name?
My name is Swarna.I am from India.
How are you? I am from Russia.
When we like something we say,
When we don’t like something we say,
I like to wear skirt and top.
I don’t like to wear salwar kameez.
I like to eat mutton biryani.
I don’t like to eat chicken.
